comment.author: 22716314@N06
comment._content:
Ty Cobb 
Tyrus Raymond Cobb (The Georgia Peach) Bats Left, Throws Right 
Height 6' 1", Weight 175 lb. 
Debut August 30, 1905 
Final Game September 11, 1928 
Born December 18, 1886 in Narrows, GA 
Died July 17, 1961 in Atlanta, GA 
Inducted into the Hall of Fame in 1936.

comment.author: 25249480@N04
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Athletes, and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: Christopher "Christy" Mathewson (August 12, 1880 – October 7, 1925), nicknamed "Big Six", "The Christian Gentleman", or "Matty", was an American right-handed pitcher in Major League Baseball. He played in what is known as the dead ball era and in 1936 was elected into the Baseball Hall of Fame as one of its inaugural members. Source: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Christy_Mathewson
